content.detailedDescription:
There is not really a story only a series of pics that i took during the month of july 2010. after looking at all pics taken i spotted these. ufo's
are circled in red. all pics were taken in my back yard at diffent times of the day.
content.summary: Pics were taken throughout the month of july of cloud formations.

content.detailedDescription: When driving on highway 55 at the intersection of #55 and #106 stopped for a break and to stretch. as we were standing there noticed a bright light moving across the sky. thought it was a satellite at first. as we wathed it moved in an irregular manner, side to side, fast and slow. it stopped and remained motionless for a few seconds and then would continue on. we began to watch closely as it continued to do this a few more times. it then stopped for a longer period of time and then circled back towards us and appeared to be now moving to us. we became anxious and uneasy as it moved closer and got in the vehicle and drove away. this is a remote strech of highway along the edge of the boreal forest with many small communities along the way.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Strange moving light that circled backwards when noticed.

content.detailedDescription: A few of my friends and myself were out on a blanket in a park in west valley, watching the stars. i had noticed a flash, very brief before it disappeared nearer the middle of the sky, eastern hemisphere if you are looking directly up. i didn't think anything of it until i saw another flash, then about three seconds later, in a different location, the same flash. this happened about six times, in a zig zag pattern before, now in the northern hemisphere of the sky, it stopped happening altogether.
content.summary: Flashing light, not like a plane.

content.detailedDescription: That day i was ariving to work abd i saw this object in the sky so i recorded it u can watch my video at *(reference to youtube link moved to additional evidence section below--sgonzalez/cms) i dont know what was it i dont say it is a spaceship i need help please, i hope u watch it ur friend **(wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms).
content.summary: Ufo over poza rica, veracruz.

content.detailedDescription: My mate and i were at the beach watching the waves to see if it was any good for surfing and i took 4 photos on my nokia e71 phone camera.. the interesting photo is the 2nd photo taken, i have no idea wat it is or could be, it dosnt look like a plane or a bird, and i didnt see it when i took the picture, i only realised something was there when i got home and had a look on my computer... i cant even try to guess its size or speed, and i cant find a shadow to try work out how far away it is.. the sun was to my left and i would have been facing almost directly east... please let me know wat u think..
content.summary: See picture.

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were at a friends house sitting in the front yard when we saw a what appeared to be a bright orange ball of fire, moving across the sky from west to east. my instant reaction was shock because it was moving fast, like a meteor, but it was staying parallel to the horizon. we all stood up to watch it as it traveled for about 30 seconds then it slowed and sharply  changed direction, moving up and away from us, southerly out over the pacific ocean. we continued watching it for another minute or so until it shrank and just went dark. i assume it moved to far away for us to see it anymore. i have never seen anything like this. it was not a plane, satellite, weather balloon or bottle rocket. it spooked me to the point that i felt driven to search online for an answer, which is how i came to find this site. 
though it looked like fire in color, there was no flickering or embers to be seen, but more of a quick pulse. this was without question, some kind of controlled object because its course was deliberate in change of direction and movement. i am torn emotionally between fear and excitement. do you have any reasonable explanation for what we saw?
content.summary: Fireball travelling across the sky at high speed, changing direction then moving up and out.

content.detailedDescription:
Hi,

while unleashing my dog in my front porch area, i noticed a bright light shining in the window.  i immediately went outside where i saw a large, very, very, very bright sphere lighting up everything.  it even outshone the nearly full moon.    it at first looked like it was larger than the moon; it was hanging a little down and to the right of the moon when it was in the southern night sky.  it looked like a huge, super bright, turquoise coloured light shining ball.


it was so bright that it appeared larger than the moon, then i realized its intense luminosity made its diameter appear larger.  the actual object was about the same size as a quarter or dollar piece held at arms length.  it did not seem to be any farther up than 10,000 ft.  its brightness lit up areas that would otherwise be cloaked in shadow, but while this object hung in the sky above, there was light enough to read a newspaper article.  it was a very surreal experience.  

then, after all of 2-3 seconds, it headed south moving at astonishing velocity.  after remaining outside for a while to watch for more activity which did not occur, i went in to tell my wife.

i'm sharing this now because of all the other similar sightings recently reported.
content.summary: Large, very bright, super fast, turquoise sphere.

content.detailedDescription: It was the middle of april.  it had been a very rainy month.  i was sleeping when i hear a loud noise which i thought was thunder and i saw a flash of light as i woke up from the loud noise, i was happy  and got up to open the window to hear the rain. i looked from the blinds ad to my surprise nothing, all was calm. my neighbors lights were out but i made the big mistake of looking up at the sky.  i live on the third floor of an apartment complex and the roof is right above me.  on the roof i saw this hugh craft some of it was just out that i cuold see right under it from  my window. it did not seem to have  its lights on and very quiet. i saw its oval shape with indentations or something like rims under and many circls and different shapes like balls under it. i moved away from the window in a way that i just wanted to hide under the covers. as i am going around my bed the strange being walks right in to my bedroom and stands at the door blocking my path and i almost bump into it. i face it with my back towards the bed and move backwards slowly as high as i can get to the top of my bed. it is looking at me and i at it.  around  maybe 3 and half feet, strange metalic suit the coverd its whole body, 2 arms and two legs and some kind of mesh covering its face. i did see whar seemed to be large eyes but no mouth or nose and i could not tell if it was male or female.  in its right hand it has an instrument with a long needle. it mde me feel like i was powerless to do anything. when it did not communicate with me i decided to talk to it. these were my exact words ,please dont hurt me. as i said those word it came right at me, i felt a grab and i blacked our when i woke up it was morning and i was on the left side of the bed, i sleep one the right side.  ever since this happpened i keep my bedroom door closed, i always kept it open. it is something that i have always believed in but never thought it would happen to me. what it did to me, if i was taken or what ever it wanted it got it in my bedroom i can not for the life of me remember. i only remember from the moment i heard the noise it matbe was the landing on the roof to the moment it came towards me and grabed me
content.summary: Saw half of what seemed like an oval with indentations under it and many circles in different shapes under it.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i work at home on computers in lake city, a suburb in north seattle. as we make our own hours, it is not uncommon for us to work late. we decided to take a break and a walk at 11pm. we walked out of our apartment and decided to walk east toward cedar park, a neighborhood of nice middle class homes. we arrived at lake city way, which is usually very busy with traffic as it is the main roadway leading to northern communities.

it was a clear, still night and the stars were were visible. no cloud in the night sky. as we crossed the 4 lane roadway, i glanced up at the sky above and saw what, at first, i thought was a satellite. it was a white glowing light in the sky moving northward. almost immediately i realized that there were three lights arranged in a triangle, with one being at the point of the northward direction that the lights were moving. in the next moment i realized that the sky was being blacked out between the triangles. this realization was accompanied by the realization that this was an object and that it was not high in the sky, but right over our heads. my background in architectural study, perspective drawing, and mechanical drawing among other skills at perspective, allowed me to take site off the trees and the buildings next to us to estimate the height of its flight, which was about fifty feet.

i instantly alerted my wife and she looked up, but, at first focused on the stars. i grabbed her arm and quickly said, "it's lower. the moving lights, look!"

when she saw what i was pointing to, she gasped. we were stunned and discussed the object as it glided absolutely silently over us as about three to four times the speed of cars that pass down lake city way. the speed limit being 40 mph.

as we watched and discussed the object, we realized it had a glowing morphing red light centered between the triangle of lights. by morphing, i mean it shifted its shape continuously, but remained contained in what seemed to be a defined space in the center of the object.

an odd point that we later discussed at length was that the light source, that is the points of light, were like like none either of us had ever seen. that is, the light seemed to emanate from the points but had no source. more like a glow of light without the center being bright. like, but not the same as fluorescent light.

backing up in my narrative of events a bit, as the object flew north, it came to a main intersection at 145th st, we were on 140th st, the object turned left, or west, at the intersection, with such a sharp turn as to seem to defy the physics of inertia. there was zero banking or slippage through the air. it turned as if it were on the ground, with none of the normal compensations necessary to overcome velocity in flight.

i don't say that it defied physics, only that it turned in a way that did not make sense to our minds, so quick and shape and sudden, with no air drag or resistance of any kind.

once the object made the turn, it accelerated at what i can only describe as rocket speed. completely silent, it made the sudden burst of energy and velocity increase toward the direction of lynnwood, a city northwest of seattle.

we discussed the object at length that night, but were cautious about sharing our experience at first.

a month later, we ran into our upstairs neighbor and her husband. she is a mother with five children, a nurse and a very responsible and grounded person. in our hallway chat, she mentioned that she saw the current ufo movie playing at the theater that night. i asked her about the movie, making small talk, and she informed me that she had a new interest in ufos because in june, her and a friend, another mother, were crossing lake city way one night and saw a black triangle fly down lake city way, heading northward. when she described the object her and her friend saw, it matched the description of what we had seen.

a final point needs to be addressed. that is that as hard as this is to explain, we all felt as if the object was oddly like a projected image, but solid at the same time. this object, in no way, could have been projected, yet it had qualities reminiscent of a projection. very odd.

we would like our name withheld from the public in general, as we have seen how people are viewed and treated when they have revealed similar experiences. the members of mufon, may, however contact us if they desire. we make no claim as to the origins of the object. we are just reporting what we saw.

now it's over a year later and we have not been able to shake the experience.

thank you for providing this forum.
content.summary: A silent black triangle with lights flew fifty feet over my and my wife's head.

content.detailedDescription:
Many years have passed since my "sighting", but i'm curios to see if other have had a like experience. i was on a summer camping trip with a group of boys. the camp director had a cabin on lake chesuncook in the wilderness around baxter state park in maine. there was a small village nearby, mostly summer cabins, but also one home that served as a bed-and-breakfast and was also the residence of the village's only year-round residents.
anyway, one night some of us decided to canoe across the lake and spend a night on one of its small islands. the island was roughly 50 by 30 feet, with a few pine trees.  while settling in for the night, looking at the night sky, suddenly appeared a glowing, bright, light blue fireball. i saw it move from the top of the trees (or so it seemed)a few yards or so laterally, and then it was gone. it scared me (i was 12 years old). i asked aloud, "did anyone else see something?"  "i did," another kid said, nervously.
i saw him some years later and asked him if he remembered the fireball. he never forgot it.  
it was rather large. it looked to be a yard or two wide, about 20 or so feet in the air. of course, it might have been much higher and therefore been much larger. at any rate, if it had been a meteorite and blazing hot (it looked like blue fire), we should have heard it hit the water. it just appeared and disappear just as fast. this was only about one or two seconds.
i've never forgotten it either. years later, when i was a counselor on the same maine trip, i told my story to another counselor. he then told me that the owners of the bed-and-breakfast told him a story that one evening, while getting into bed, a bright blue light lit up their room, apparently coming from a source outside. that's all i remember of the story.

has anyone had a similar experience, have a theory about what i might have seen?
content.summary: Dayglo light blue fireball passed over.

content.detailedDescription: It was a summer night when i lived in london, ontario on the 5th floor of an apartment building with a balcony facing west.  my roommate and his cousin stepped out onto the balcony for a cigarette and saw something in the sky.  they called my friend and i out to see what they were seeing.  the 4 of us witnessed 6 bright white lights arranged in a hexagon formation.  i didn't know what the lights were, but they seemed to bright to be aircraft approach lights.  the formation appeared to be far from us and at least 10 times the size of a full moon.  we turned on the radio and the local station was reporting getting calls from all up and down highway 401 from london to windsor.  at this time, i was sent to the 11th floor to get our friend's roommate so he could see it, too.  when i returned to my apartment, the lights appeared to have sunk beyond the horizon like the setting sun, leaving only the top 4 lights visible.  we watched until all 6 were gone below our line of sight.  the radio announced the next day that the lights witnessed over southern ontario were american fighter jets doing practice manuevers.  i have witnessed landing lights on aircraft approaching london international airport from that balcony.  i've seen spotlights from military and police helicopters from that balcony.  now, if the radio report is to believed, i've seen lights brighter than landing lights on aircraft moving very slowly away from me.
content.summary: 6 bright lights in a hexagon formation sinking beyond the horizon.

content.detailedDescription:
This incident happened at our home. my husband and children were sitting at the back porch table enjoying the evening. a stormfront had brought in cooler evening air.  
directly east of where i was sitting on my back porch was my neighbor's house behind our home. i was starring off really at nothing, directly above their roofline. into my line of vision came a light. an orange light. it looked like fire, however it is rising. momments later i realize its  suspended in air and it is continuing to rise. now  i can't be sure on its size or how far off it was. but i'll make the guess that it is less than a mile away and at its altitude, the size of a vehicle.
now when i say it looked like fire, i'm saying it was fire. i actually saw orange and yellow flames licking at each other. like if you were to suspend a bonfire in the air. the flames were contained to a rounded shape and didn't 'streak' as it moved upward. it rapidly gained altitude, straight up from its location.
at this point i know that i have to get my husband to see this. luckily he was walking back outside and i point to it and say, "look! it looks like fire" by this time it was high up there. higher than a helicopter flies but lower than the commercial airline planes that fly over our house on their descent into the airport. he agrees that it looks like fire, but by this point the distinct look of flames has become more of a shimmer. as we are watching, it makes an obvious  acceleration to the east towards claremore. we watched it until it was completely out of our vision.  this entire incident happened in less than 2 minutes.
content.summary: Orb shaped fireball ascended from field area. rose to a considerable altitude then headed east until no longer visible.

content.detailedDescription:
I was bbqing behind my house in a hay field yesterday around 5:00 pm. the hay field is developed for camping grounds and about half the field has been cut with a lawnmower. me and another camper were sitting in lawn chairs near the bbq, unfortunately drinking some beers. i suddenly heard a private airplane (a small one) flying from east to west, fairly low and relatively loud. when i looked up at the private plane, i noticed a white object flying several feet above the private plane, and the white object was going from west to east. they did not appear to be parallel with each other though. if the white object was making a noise, it was over powered by the lower flying private plane. 

the white object (may have been a light grey color or something) did not appear to have wings. it litterally appeared to just be a cylinder or cigar although the object was at a significant height and the wings may have been difficult, if not impossible to view from my point. 

when i seen this object, i stared for about 30 seconds before pointing it out to my drunken camping buddy. he was able to hear and see the private plane, but i just couldn't get him to focus enough to see what i was seeing. i pointed out a small cloud to him which he was able to find, and the object was slightly under the cloud (from our ground view) but i couldn't get him to see it. eventually, as i continued to point out the object, it continued flying east at a uniform speed until it was too small and far away to see myself. 

it is in my opinion, this object was simply a commercial airliner which was flying too high to be heard, or to distinguish any descriptive features on it. regardless, i am not 100 percent, or even 99.99 percent sure that this was an airplane.

...Previous encounters: me, my mom (rip), and my neighbor seen a strange hovering light moving to slow to be conventional aircraft, and was to quiet (cant remember, but i think it was silent) to be a helicopter, and this was at night; around 10-11ish pm. the object hovered in the camping field i mentioned earlier and hovered over and past my house in a southern direction. i called my neighbor as soon as i seen it and he was over in about 2 mins (lives 400 meters away). i met him outside where we watched this thing up close. it had bright white lights (i think) but the one thing i remember for sure is the earthly structure of this craft. it appeared to have a crane like structure to it (only an iron (looked like iron) frame with no exterior). the object may have been approx 20 meters by 20 meters (irregular shape). hovered 100 feet off ground approx in the camping field then moved over my house southerly and hovered in a field across the road where we got a good look at it. then it continued moving south but started to curve south west and up! wish i had more details.
content.summary: White (silent?) cigar shaped object at average travel speeds.

content.detailedDescription: I and my boyfriend were on a seventh story roof in bensonhurst, brooklyn, ny watching fireworks on july 4th night. it was between 10:30 and 11pm and the fireworks were dying down. my boyfriend asked me if the pieces of fireworks could reach us and i told him the were too far away (at least 10 city blocks away was the closest any firweorks were being set off). then a little later he pointed at something that appeared to be on fire moving toward us and asked me if that might reach us. we first began to back across the roof thinking it was a piece of flaming debris, even though there were no fireworks going off anywhere near us. it took me a few seconds to realize it wasn't falling and wasn't fireworks. we stood still and waited for it to pass over head. it looked just like a perfect orb of fire. it had no tail and was not obstructed by any clouds or fireworks. it was silent and glowing orange, did not flash. it moved at a  constant speed directly overhead. it was closer than stars, seemed much closer than a plane. it was silent and moved in a straight line. it did not get bigger or smaller and did not appear to be falling. we followed it until it disappeared far into the sky in the distance. i have seen many fireworks of all types throughout my life including flares, parachute fireworks and duds and partially-exploded mortars, this was not fireworks. i have lived under the jfk flight paths my entire life. this was not a plane of any kind. no running lights and no sound. it took almost a minute to pass over us, so we got a good look at it. it seemed perfectly round and like it was on fire but much closer than a star. it was not something that you sometimes see come through and burn up in the atmosphere like meteorites or meteor showers (i have seen many). it was constant in its speed and altitude and was not something falling to earth. as close as it was within the atmosphere, if it was just a piece of something in the atmosphere i would have expected it to fall towards earth. some force kept it eleveated and travelling horizontally. i have never seen anything unexplainable in the sky before this. neither in the city or catskill mountains where i frequently visit my family. seeing a ufo was the furthest thing from our mind on that 4th of july. i felt absolutely crazy trying to explain this to my family until i went online and saw that i was not alone.
content.summary: Orange sphere, perfect orb of fire, no tail, slow moving, steady light (no flashing).

content.detailedDescription: "going east down lighting ridge.The hill about 500ft-were about 1/2 way down hill,when two bright blue white lites struck us.We watched it for about 10 sec.Then it lifted with the lights slightly raised.It lifted and went south."
content.summary: A disc type object,approx.75 feet in diameter with a bright light on both edges

content.detailedDescription: Scottdale, pennsylvania. my son and i stepped out our back door onto a deck. time was 10:59 p.M. i looked up into the northeast sky and saw what appeared to be a huge, green fireball moving in a downward direction. i yelled for my son to look up - which he did - and we both watched it as it disappeared from our vantage point below a neighbor's roof line. i probably saw the object for no more than 3 seconds; and my son saw it for probably just 2 seconds. his description is the same as mine - about the size of a nickel held at arm's length. but he says there was fire coming from behind it. i quickly did a time check. i remained outside for an additional 30 minutes, but did not see it or anything like it again.
content.summary: Huge green fireball moved in a downward motion over scottdale.

content.detailedDescription: I was looking at the moon and thought there was too many in a row then there through the trees.That's when i saw it, it was a disc shaped object with a faint blue rim and two big head lights.It sound like a jet but it would have been bigger and it would have faster.I also think that planes don't fly over my house it never happened before and the only flying thing i saw around my house was a helicopter once.But about 10:40 or 10:54 and i was watching it fly by it was close to over my tree an just at the a little from the top head lights pointed a little to the right of my position.Then it went on from there. as soon as it passed by i drew a bad speed draft and went to bed at about a 11:00 maybe. i was in the back of my house when it happen watching from from the glass double doors i don't think it saw me other wise it would probably bolted.I lost sight of it when it flew over my house.
content.summary: A disc shaped ufo flew over my house!

content.detailedDescription:
Last night/early this morning around 1:47 a.M., myself, my niece and my nephew spotted a strange object heading westward over the indianapolis skyline.

we were heading northeast in my car on state road 67 north, and we were about 3 or 4 miles from i-465 (a loop that surrounds the city).  the indianapolis international airport is only about 5/6 miles from the location where we spotted the object, so it is not unusual to see aircraft flying around this area.  

the object we spotted, however, was flying in the direction of the airport and was dead ahead of us.  at first, i  thought it might be an airplane.  but... i noticed very quickly that this did not seem like an airplane.  i immediately pointed this out to my niece (age 12) and my nephew (age 17) -- "look at that guys..." and they looked up... what we saw were two white lights, spread apart quite aways, flying very quickly in a very straight line (if it was an airplane landing, it obviously would have been coming down at an angle).  it most likely was over a mile away from my best guess... and from what we could tell, it seemed to be very close to "tree top level."  the sighting lasted less than 10 seconds.  it was moving very fast.

some more details:   

--  it was cloudy (it had just rained about an hour before)
--  the white lights seemed to be rectangular to me, but i am not certain
--  my best guess is the two white lights were on one craft, and the lights were not 2 separate craft.
--  my nephew said he saw it flash 5 times and disappear.  this i did not notice -- i think the "flashing" can be attributed to it disappearing behind trees (?)
--  my niece said she notice an oval shape around the lights (my nephew and i did not notice this).  she mentioned it was similar to seeing the "moon's shadow" during a crescent moon.

i've checked online to see if anyone else has reported seeing this, but i've not found anything.
content.summary: Strange, fast moving lights spotted just above tree level near indianapolis.

content.detailedDescription: Driving down the road and saw this line in the sky that look like dashes in the sky kind of a curved line. stay ther for about 30 seconds then it was gone.
content.summary: A long line in the sky that looked like dashes.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: I was in the passenger seat driving home. i look up in the sky and i see a oval shaped disc that seemed moderatly large and very shiny like aluminum. it also apeared that it had two light sorces from my perspective. then after 5-10 seconds a tree blocked my view for 3 seconds and the object vanished. there was nothing in sight, i looked for planes or anything. nothing was there, at the location i saw it. it wasn't traveling fast either, it was just hovering, apearing to stay in place. it almost seemed as if it knew i was looking, then when it had it's chance vanished. the object was pretty far away as well, it was farther away than for me to see it with any detail. all i could see was it's shape, luster, and light source.
content.summary: I saw it for 5-10 seconds and then after i passed a tree it was gone.

content.detailedDescription:
I was just taking pictures of seaplanes near canada place in vancouver. when i got home and looked over the pictures, i spotted this strange object. i thought it was just another seaplane, but upon closer inspection, it appeared different in shape. i didn't notice it while taking the picture since i was concentrating on catching the plane i wanted to photograph, and i didn't hear it, or dismissed it as there were other seaplanes making noise in the background.

is this what i think it is?
content.summary: Ufo spotted in picture.

content.detailedDescription:
On a day trip around mount rainier we were traveling up the road from highway 410 on the east side of the mountain to sunrise lodge. i was stopping along the way to take pictures of the scenery. i noticed what i thought was a spot on a picture of the mountain after enlarging it back home in california. i zoomed in on it and decided to share it. i also sent in two pictures previously of images from near skykomish. to get three pictures in two weeks in the same general area?...I decided to check all the pictures closely. these three were of interest. i had no intention of photographing ufo's. i was only there to photograph scenery.
at the time i took these pictures i noticed and heard nothing out of the ordinary. the camera used was a canon powershot a560 with 7.1 mega pixels.
content.summary: Noticed image on picture from mount rainier on road to sunrise lodge.

content.detailedDescription:
25 minute event of a triangle shaped object seen by many on interstate 40 in new mexico, between clines corner and tijera,new mexico

in january of 1979, my family and i were driving home to albuquerque from a cross country trip from massachusetts after the christmas season. we had stopped in tucumcari for a family bathroom and stretching break; this had been a 2000+ mile journey and we were on day 5, the home stretch.

it was still light out and the sun was preparing to set in the hour when we left tucumcari; the only thing unusual observed in the sky was multiple "morning glory" cloud formations that we passed under, on route 40. this in itself was unusual because "morning glories" are very rare.

as it grew dark on the long stretch of road called interstate 40, which cuts through from the boarder of the pan handle of texas; straight through to albuquerque, a 217 mile 3+ hour journey, at 9 years old you wonder if this trip is ever going to end.

i can only approximate the time as being about 8:00pm when somewhere between clines corner, new mexico and tijeras, new mexico on interstate route 40 an event that was observed by all 4 members of my family that we will never forget.

off in the distance a tower with anti-collision lights could be observed, it was on the left hand side of the road; it must have been a large tower because, the outline obscured in the darkness was visible from quite aways away.

but there was something peculiar about this tower, above it was what appeared to be 3 spinning flashing lights; which when viewed at a distance were not attached to the tower.

my mother then asked my father: " __________ is that a helicopter?" my father answered: "maybe, but, my mother:��� but what???��� my father:��� i don���t know ____________ , ,,,,, its too windy,,,, i don���t now what it is..��� 

as we drew closer to the tower, (possibly a weather or communication station, no cell towers back then) we observed 1 or 2 smaller structures under the tower from a distance; and an unidentified air craft maintaining distance above the tower itself.

at this point we were still a ways away from the tower station, but we could notice that this object was spinning; the approximate spin was about 90��� per second or one complete revolution per 4 seconds.

as we drew closer to the object we could see a distinct triangular form, which was in my estimation at least 100 feet across. it was at this point that this object began to gain altitude and loose altitude like a bounce on a trampoline.

this increase and decrease in elevation was effortless and smooth, and at first it was in increments of maybe 20 feet; vertical up and down on the top part of the tower, and at no time did this object stop spinning.

on this particular stretch of road it was very windy, the sheer alone was blowing tractor trailer trucks all over the road; but this object displayed no lateral vectoring what so ever, every time it raised in elevation or lost elevation the object did so in a straight ballistic line. (my father���s last duty in the navy was a chopper trainer, he said that it was impossible for a helicopter to maintain position like that in those winds and not experience some lateral vectoring) 

the closer we drew to the object the more distinct it became, the object then moved slightly away from the tower and stopped in the center of the tower ���yard; at this point the object began to bounce gracefully in approximately 50 foot drops and 50 accessions, all the time still spinning.

my mother tried to take some pictures of the object but as far as i know they never came out.

 my father and mother opened their windows, in order to try to here if the sound of a copter was present, but the only sound heard was road noise; and at this distance, if it was a helicopter one would have been able to hear the roar.It was now clear to my parents and i that this was no helicopter.

as we were passing the tower station, the object leisurely and effortlessly moved and began to follow the highway; particularly our white suburban truck. at this point, my mother began to flip out, and begged my father to get off the highway, but we just kept driving.

this is where the events of this night become weird, as we were driving the craft took up position above our truck and started to flash bright, and i mean bright flashes of directed light into our vehicle, particularly at me. they were brighter than any police or emergency vehicle or anti -collision light i have ever seen.

first flashes of: yellow, than flashes of red, than blue, than green, than blue than red, than green and finally blue.

after a while the object flew slowly away east bound in to the sky and out of sight straight up.

this whole event from start to finish lasted from 20 to 25 minutes; i have tried using google earth to locate the precise location of where this event occurred, but much of the topography there has changed since i was a kid.

what has bothered me over the years is that there were other witness to this event on that stretch of interstate 40 that night; none as far as i know, have ever reported this event.

my current vocation is a licensed and soon to be ordained pastor, there is a big risk for me to even speak out these events, but they must be told.

this was not the only experience my family and i had in new mexico; there was another one, just as weird.
content.distance: 21-100 Feet, 101-500 Feet, 501 Feet - 1 Mile, Over 1 Mile
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Other
content.summary: 25 minute event of a triangle shaped object seen by many on interstate 40 in new mexico, between clines corner and tijera,new mexico.

content.detailedDescription:
i was on vacation in washington state. i was out in my pickup that i keep at my sister���s house, doing some fishing and taking pictures of the scenery. it was a clear blue sky and i was east of skykomish at the martin creek trailhead for the iron goat trail. i thought i would head further up the road past the trailhead parking area on us forest service road 6710 for some pictures. (there were two cars in the dirt parking lot).  further on, i passed a parked, white full size van with a family that had been apparently hiking. i came to a side road that headed up the mountain on my right. i decided to take that road up to get some pictures of the scenery. i then decided i would drive up as far as i could go to where i could turn around safely. i found that spot and turned around and stopped to get my pictures. from this spot i took 11 pictures, a few east up the valley and a few back down the road i had just come up. i finally got back in my truck and headed back down the hill. it was not until after my vacation when i returned back to california that i reviewed the pictures after they were enlarged on my computer at work. i noticed on three pictures a spot that i thought must have been on the lens. all the other pictures had nothing on them. one was taken up the valley to the east, one to the west and the other at mount rainier the next week. i became very interested when i enlarged these photos and wanted someone to take a look at them. i was using a canon powershot a560 digital camera. (7.1 mega pixels). thanks for your time.

i have made a seperate report for the mount rainier siting.
content.summary: Noticed images on camera after returning from vacation.

content.detailedDescription:
His event not call my atention until i saw the picture in my camera, i was seat in fron of the building about two blocks away. my objective of the picture was the building.

i'm a amateur photograph.

1) i was two block away of my picture target
2) i jus notice when i check my camera
3) ufo, if you see inside of the clouds you can see more of them
4) oval, i didn't see in motion
5) surprised 
6) i just didn',t see it
content.summary: This event not call my atention until i saw the picture in my camera, i was seat in front of the building about two blocks away. my objective of the picture was the building.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife "t" and i were sitting on our deck facing west around 8:40 pm. there is always a lot of air traffic in this west view so we are used to jets coming and going from salt lake international airport, which is to the north. something a little odd caught my attention just after the sun went down but before it got all the way dark. 
i spotted a very black sphere in the west, and it wasn't moving. it just hung in the sky in that exact spot for about 3 minutes. my wife said,"it's just a plane."
i said,"if it's a plane then why is it not moving and where are it's lights?"
she noticed then that it wasn't moving and we started to get excited. i ran inside the house to get my binoculars and when i returned my wife, who had kept the object in view said, "it's gone now."
i looked with my binoculars where i had seen it before and it seemed to be gone but after a cloud moved past i could see it again. it was very black, reflecting no light whatsoever. i've never seen anything like it. there was a lot of wind and clouds. i could see it again when the clouds thinned out but within a minute or so after that it was gone. 
the oddest thing about it was that it stayed in the same spot in the sky this whole time. if it had been a balloon of some sort it would have had to move in the wind. this black sphere never moved but stayed fixed in this position the whole time it was in our field of view. so then since we could not see it anymore we sat back down on the deck and discussed what we had seen. 
after about 5 minutes my wife went inside for something and i was still on the deck sitting in my chair when something very big swooped silently over my head and i saw its dark shadow out of the corner of my eye. at first i thought it was a big bird because i could not see it clearly but something had definitely flown over my head so fast that i could only see the shadow of it as it passed. i ran to the other side of my deck but i couldn't see anything. it really seemed far too big to be a bird. we don't get eagles or any other kind of big birds in the city. it was completely silent. 
"ok," i thought to myself,"now i finally have something to report to mufon!"
unfortunately this whole sighting was in the near dusk so pictures would have been impossible, but my wife and i definitely saw this very black sphere fixed in the sky. it kind of reminded me of a black hole, the way it just stayed there as clouds moved in front of it and in back of it with the wind and it didn't move at all. i could make a sketch but it would just be a black ball or sphere with no lights or markings.
content.summary: We saw a black sphere hanging in the western sky. it didn't move at all and was eventually obscured by clouds.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i got home from a friends house about 2 in the morning and we went out onto the back porch and it wasn't but a few seconds later, i looked up and over the trees there was this blue ball of light flying west and i told my wife to look and then as she saw the blue light, it started splitting into 2 balls and almost instantly turned and orange / red color as it kept the same speed and kept going across the sky til it was out of visual range. it never made any noise or anything. i will never forget it.
content.summary: 1 blue sphere splits into 2 orange/red spheres.

content.detailedDescription: Well, i was looking in the sky towards where the sun sets because i was watching for the meteor shower... there was a bright light in the sky that i assumed was a planet. i got my binoculars and realized that this thing that is suspended in the sky has a red light... then i told my wife to come look and i was thinking my eyes were playing tricks on me, but she looked throught the binoculars and saw the red light too. anyhow, i watched it and watched it and it was basically "setting" like the stars or sun, but the thing with this is there was a point where the bright white light turned off and all you could see was the red light and then a few seconds later, the red light disappeared as well. i watched this thing disappear in the clear sky and i walked around my house to look and it was just simply gone. i walked back around the the back porch where i was originally and before i got up the stairs my wife told me that its' back... i was amazed!! i knew for a fact now that this thing was not a planet, but something up there that was just sitting still enough to "set" as the earth rotated. it got on down near the horizon and appeared to now be blinking white and red, but that could have been because it was so far away. it did disappear and reappear one more time before i decided it's too far away to even watch anymore. i had thought maybe it was the space station, but i've heard that it travels across the sky at a high rate of speed... this thing i saw simply was not moving at all.
content.summary: Bright light (looked like planet) with a red light on it.

content.detailedDescription:
Was taking pictures of the sunset while on an alaska cruise.  didn't see the object when taking the photo, although, i did have a feeling as though something would appear on the photo.  
upon my return home, was sifting through the photos on my camera, and the object caught my eye.  is this a ufo?

note: time on camera shows 10:40 pst (california).  alaska is 1hr behind 9:40pm.
content.summary: Could this be a ufo?

content.detailedDescription: I had just arrived home from the store and was outside in my apartments parking lot putting together something in my work van. i was looking in the sky because i always do in hoping i'll see a ufo, and i seen the big orange bright star-like object in the sky. i just assumed it was probably venus or something like that, and let me mention this is not the first time i've seen this, but the first time it actually made me have goosebumps as i'll explain. anyways, my girlfriend came outside on my apartment balcony (on 2nd floor) to see what i was doing and i said "look at that, its a ufo!" joking, because she makes fun of my new profound interest in ufos and the possibility of alien life and thinks i'm just crazy. anyways, i go back to work in my van, it's probably 10:00-10:30pm now and i look back up at the orange sphere star in the sky and notice that it's not really sphere shaped. my eyes were a little off and hard to adjust from the light i was working with in my van to the night sky but i'm positive if looked at through a telescope, this thing was not just sphere shaped, nor a star. i think i'm just trying to make myself see something else than what it really is and go back to working, but constantly looking up in the sky everywhere because i keep catching glimpses of lights in the sky, only to find out its just airplanes coming from dfw airport. then i turn my attention back to this orange star thing and notice that this thing has moved from where i originally seen it. it's only been 15 minutes since i told my girlfriend to check it out, its 10:45pm now, and i had noticed some actual stars in the sky near this object before and they hadn't moved so i knew something was up then. i called my girlfriend on my cell and said "hey that thing is moving! come out here and see" she then came out and seen it and wasn't all that excited about it and just said "it's just a airplane, it's not a ufo! people are going to think your crazy out here just staring up in the sky" i then knew she wasn't going to be my witness and i have no idea how she thought this thing was a plane. it had no sound, no blinking lights, and if it was a plane, it would have been long gone by then, not just hovering. she goes back inside and i'm fixed on watching this thing. then out of no where, something flies by at high speed passing the orange sphere, also no sound and had red blinking lights all over it. i then started seeing the orange sphere slowly move right and down. i was thinking maybe the night sky was just moving like normal but the same stars i was looking at was in the same spot. another 10 minutes pass and the orange sphere is now ducking below the tree line, almost completely out of sight, just peeking at me through two telephone poles, and then, gone. i was now convinced i had just saw something strange and hoped it was a ufo. i come back inside my apartment and get on the internet to google about the orange sphere on tonights date and whaddya know....Other people seen it as well! i then proceeded to see how i could report it, and here i am! sorry no pictures or video, will have camera on me next time! also during this whole sighting, about the time this sphere started to move, it seemed like a storm was coming in from the east. it got real windy and clouds were coming in but then all the sudden stopped?!? airplane my left foot!
content.summary: Huge bright orange moving sphere
